title: Shaquelle Evans
text:
Shaquelle "Shaq" Evans (born March 7, 1991) is an American professional <a href="gridiron%20football">football</a> <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> for the <a href="Saskatchewan%20Roughriders">Saskatchewan Roughriders</a> of the <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">Canadian Football League</a> (CFL). He was drafted by the <a href="New%20York%20Jets">New York Jets</a> in the fourth round of the <a href="2014%20NFL%20Draft">2014 NFL Draft</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="UCLA%20Bruins%20football">UCLA</a>.
Early years.
Evans was selected and participated in the Hawaii Prep Football Classic. He played in the U.S. Army All-American game. He was selected to SuperPrep All-America team in high school. He was named to the Western 100 by the Tacoma News-Tribune in high school. He was selected to the all-state third team by CalHiSports.com following his senior year in high school.
College career.
Evans originally attended Notre Dame, but decided to transfer to UCLA due to the proximity to home. Evans was on the watchlist for the <a href="Fred%20Biletnikoff%20Award">Fred Biletnikoff Award</a> prior to his senior year. He was an all-conference honorable mention that season, helping the Bruins to a 10 win season.
Professional career.
New York Jets.
On May 10, 2014, he was drafted by the <a href="New%20York%20Jets">New York Jets</a> in the fourth round, 115 overall of the <a href="2014%20NFL%20Draft">2014 NFL Draft</a>. He signed a 4-year, $2.67 million contract on May 15, 2014. Before he could appear in an NFL game, Evans was placed on injured reserve on August 19, 2014 with a shoulder injury.
On September 5, 2015, the Jets waived Evans.
Jacksonville Jaguars.
Evans was signed to the Jacksonville Jaguars practice squad on September 29, 2015. On September 3, 2016, he was released by the Jaguars. He was signed to the Jaguars' practice squad the next day. He was released on September 13.
New England Patriots.
Evans was signed to the <a href="New%20England%20Patriots">New England Patriots</a>' practice squad on October 12, 2016. On October 20, 2016, the Patriots released Evans from their practice squad.
Dallas Cowboys.
On January 4, 2017, Evans was signed to the Cowboys' practice squad. He signed a reserve/future contract with the Cowboys on January 16, 2017.
On April 21, 2017, Evans was suspended the first four games of the 2017 season for violating the league’s drug policy. On April 27, 2017, Evans was waived by the Cowboys.
Saskatchewan Roughriders.
On February 22, 2018, Evans signed with the <a href="Saskatchewan%20Roughriders">Saskatchewan Roughriders</a>. He played in 17 regular season games in 2018 where he had 50 receptions for 785 yards. In 2019, Evans had 72 receptions and 1334 receiving yards and scored five touchdowns en route to being named a CFL All-Star. He signed a one-year contract extension with the team on December 24, 2020. In his third season with the club Evans played in seven games, catching 25 passes for 244 yards. On January 18, 2022 Evans and the Riders agreed to a contract extension.
